text: so HubSpot autoconverts images to webp which is awesome… but i’m noticing one of my sites is getting penalized by PageSpeed Insights for not using next-gen formats. is there anyway to force the creation of the .webp files <@U22PJPGK0>  ?
just realized its my CSS backgrounds… which makes it tough to deal with
need to use modernizer to detect if webp is supported and then write multiple CSS rules
actually i found an ultra lightweight JS async script here <https://davidwalsh.name/detect-webp>
The speed tools sometimes just check file names. The image filename doesn't change the way HS does it
So they are false positives in the tool. Nothing you need to do
Hello all, how do I go about adding a snippet of code for a HubSpot CTA into the footer signature of an email?

Hi, i have used the "Image (Email) " Module for the Logo in my Email. It handles the rendering well but for some reason the Logo, which is also this Module and not the "Company Logo" Module, gets up-scaled on mobile to 100%. Is there a way to prevent this?

Just curious, but did HubSpot roll out some new feature with how nested groups display in the page editor for custom modules?
Seems like if a group has a nested repeater  + some other fields it displays like this... but checking a few other modules I've been working on don't have a similar appearance.
In case anybody else reads this Jon is 100% correct and it was a bug with the particular portal i was working in
They've been playing around with this look for awhile i think they're still in testing. They found there are pros and cons to both ways they display the items
So it may be kind of an A/B test your seeing
